sentence.Network_cn: 安东尼自鸣得意，忘乎所以。

sentence.Network_en: Being there gave me a giddy pleasure.
sentence.Network_cn: 身处那个地方让我激动得难以自持。

sentence.Network_en: When I looked down from the top floor, I felt giddy.
sentence.Network_cn: 我从顶楼朝下看时感到头晕目眩。

list.abs: Sinograma « 发 » - Diccionario de Sinogramas ... 发挥[ bring into play] 发昏[ feel giddy;feel dizzy] 发货[ deliver goods].
giddy是什么意思... ... act the giddy goat v. 胡闹 feel giddy 发晕，发昏 play the giddy goat 行为如小丑胡闹.
She is a giddy thing ., 她是个轻浮的人.
A virtuous but giddy girl attempts to play a trick on a man ., 一个善良可轻浮的姑娘想开一个男人的玩笑.
Why did I see computer time grow giddy head to go up ?, 为什么我看电脑时间长了头晕脑涨的?

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gidig 'insane', literally 'possessed by a god', from the base of God. Current senses date from late Middle English

entry.def: If you feel giddy, you feel unsteady and think that you are about to fall over, usually because you are not well.

entry.tran: （高兴或激动得）发狂的，举止反常的
entry.def: If you feel giddy with delight or excitement, you feel so happy or excited that you find it hard to think or act normally.

example.tran: 安东尼自鸣得意，忘乎所以。

example.ex: Being there gave me a giddy pleasure.
example.tran: 身处那个地方让我激动得难以自持。

means.word_mean: 1. having or causing a whirling sensation; liable to falling;

sentences.sentence: "feeling woozy from the blow on his head"
"a vertiginous climb up the face of the cliff"

auth_sentence.content: Everyone was giddy, like children on Christmas morning.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everyone was giddy, like children on Christmas morning.

auth_sentence.content: Matching them in giddy recklessness, Columbia acceded.
auth_sentence.res_content: Matching them in giddy recklessness, Columbia acceded.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Matching them in giddy recklessness, Columbia acceded.

auth_sentence.content: The past couple of weeks had been a giddy time.
auth_sentence.res_content: The past couple of weeks had been a giddy time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The past couple of weeks had been a giddy time.

means.word_mean: 眩晕的,头晕的;令人眩晕的,令人头晕的

sentences.en: Steep stairs may leave you giddy and faint.
sentences.cn: 陡直的楼梯可使人头晕目眩。

sentences.en: I was giddy with the heat.

means.word_mean: 轻浮的,不稳重的,轻率的

sentences.en: Some boys are always acting the giddy goat,behaving foolishly.
sentences.cn: 有些男孩子常常胡闹,举止荒唐。
